title: Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky ditch the Melbourne Spring Racing Carnival for a Byron Bay party
text:
They're the A-listers who ditched living in Hollywood for a more relaxed life in Byron Bay.

And now Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky are proving that they're locals through and through.

According to The Sydney Morning Herald, the couple will be ditching the Melbourne Spring Racing Carnival next Saturday and will be attending a pool party in Byron instead.

They're locals through and through! Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky ditch the glamorous Melbourne Spring Racing Carnival for a Byron Bay pool party

The pair are rumoured to be attending a bash at Rae's on Wategos to celebrate its 25th anniversary, which is owned by media personality Anthony Catalano.

James Lyell from Flight Facilities will be performing for the crowd.

Chris and Elsa relocated to Byron Bay in 2014, and have just built a stunning $20 million mansion at Broken Head.

A low-key life: Chris and Elsa relocated to Byron Bay in 2014, and have just built a stunning $20 million mansion at Broken Head

In June, Australian star Chris spoke about moving back Down Under with his family.

Speaking to OK! Magazine, the father-of-three said that moving back was a 'good decision' for the pair.

'There I can be with people and talk about things that have nothing to do with the film business,' Chris said.

'Good decision': In June, Australian star Chris spoke about moving back Down Under with his family

'That's almost impossible in Los Angeles, where there's rarely a moment when you can forget that you're an actor.'

The Thor star added: 'Living in Australia allows me to be away from a world where where you can lose touch with reality sometimes.'

Meanwhile Elsa told The Sydney Morning Herald in December that moving to Byron was her 'dream.'

'Growing up I was very happy in nature, with animals, and I dreamed of living in a place where my kids can run around with no shoes on, surrounded by all kinds of animals - dangerous and not dangerous,' she said.
description: They're the A-listers who ditched living in Hollywood for a more relaxed life in Byron Bay.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
